linkedin_groups: group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=5180384&goback=, group_name:-Precision Medicine Insight, no_of_members:-10507, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/p/7/005/021/377/300a882.png, group_id:-5180384, group_description:-Precision Medicine is an approach to discover and develop medicines, vaccines or routes of intervention (behavior, nutrition, etc.) that enable disease prevention and deliver superior therapeutic outcomes for patients, by integrating clinical, molecular (multi-omics including epigenetics), environmental and behavioral (Big Data) information to understand the biological basis of disease. This effort leads to better selection of disease targets and identification of patient populations that demonstrate improved clinical outcomes to novel preventive and therapeutic approaches. In order to achieve this goal novel standards to harvest raw data (SOPs), processes, as well as architectures/analytics including new artificial intelligence, IoT and ICT technologies are instrumental to enable implementation and delivery of Precision Medicine 24/7 anywhere anytime in the world. Data in general will become the crude oil and currency of the future, while safety, security, ownership, privacy and so on constitute ethical challegenches that need to be discussed alongside technical solutions to foster novel business and improve health care <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=142742&goback=, group_name:-American Society of Human Genetics - ASHG, no_of_members:-23912, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/p/3/000/013/215/097a204.png, group_id:-142742, group_description:-The American Society of Human Genetics (ASHG) is the primary professional membership organization for human genetics specialists worldwide. The Society's nearly 8,000 members include researchers, academicians, clinicians, genetic counselors, and others who have a special interest in human genetics. ASHG serves research scientists, health professionals, and the public by providing forums to: 1) Share research results at annual meetings and in The American Journal of Human Genetics; 2) Advance genetic research by advocating for research support; 3) Enhance genetics education by preparing future professionals and informing the public; and 4) Promote genetic services and support responsible social and scientific policies. Note that membership in this LinkedIn group does not imply membership in ASHG. To join the Society, submit your application here: http://www.ashg.org/pages/member_overview.shtml. <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=165490&goback=, group_name:-Drug Discovery & Development Professionals, no_of_members:-16413, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/p/2/000/025/278/12e2d6f.png, group_id:-165490, group_description:-For professionals working on drug discovery or development projects. Meet scientists and business executives with challenges similar to your own and find out what solutions worked for them. Group is affiliated with Drug Discovery & Development of Innovative Therapeutics conference, www.drugdisc.com. <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=3141702&goback=, group_name:-Bio-IT World, no_of_members:-21209, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/p/3/000/060/2f9/05cdc48.png, group_id:-3141702, group_description:-Bio-IT World focuses on the technologies deployed and strategic decisions made by companies in these areas, and their impact on performance. As the biopharma industry transforms itself from empirical trial-and-error experimentation to an industry reliant upon information, computation, and prediction of outcomes, technologies such as high-throughput genotyping, microarray analysis, and bioinformatics are providing the means of gathering, interpreting, and analyzing biological, chemical, and clinical data to further drug discovery and development. Bio-IT World covers the latest developments in these fields. Focus areas include: Genomic analysis: next-generation sequencing, genome-wide association mapping, and data integration Discovery informatics: collection, analysis and workflows of compound, microarray, proteomic, imaging, and pre-clinical and clinical data Systems biology: gene, protein, metabolite, and network/pathway information Computational modeling: biosimulations of pathways, drug action, and clinical data Predictiveness: in vitro assays, biomarkers, and animal models Cheminformatics: structure-based drug design, compound characterization, ADME-Tox, and selectivity Correlation of biological data: disease diagnosis, patient selection, and drug response Target data: biological, pathway, interaction, patent, and family IT infrastructure: grid computing and high-performance computing Text mining: internal documents and published literature Semantic web: next-generation data sharing and social networking Clinical research: electronic data capture, patient recruitment, and adaptive trials Pharmacogenomics: diagnostics for therapeutics, patient stratification Subscribe to Bio-IT Worlds free e-newsletters at www.Bio-ITWorld.com <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=5064109&goback=, group_name:-CRISPR Forum, no_of_members:-3471, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/p/3/005/03d/387/24bc5ee.png, group_id:-5064109, group_description:-Welcome! You are viewing the First and the largest LinkedIn-CRISPR Networking Group. CRISPRs (Clustered Regularly Interspaced Short Palindromic Repeats) multiple short direct repeats that are found in the genomes of approximately 40% of bacteria. CRISPR functions as a prokaryotic immune system, in that it confers resistance to exogenous genetic elements. The CRISPR system provides a form of immunity. Short segments of foreign DNA, called spacers, are incorporated into the genome between CRISPR repeats, and serve as a 'memory' of past exposures. CRISPR spacers are then used to recognise and silence exogenous genetic elements in a manner analogous to RNAi in eukaryotic organisms. CRISPRs have thus huge potential to commandeer the down-regulation, expression and importantly, the KO of eukaryotic genes. <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=122465&goback=, group_name:-Personalized Medicine, no_of_members:-12073, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/p/1/000/19d/129/2a412dd.png, group_id:-122465, group_description:-This group focusses on the dramatic shift taking place in pharma industry and healthcare moving from the "one-size-fits-it-all" approach to targeted treatment solutions and eventually the individual pill for each patient. <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=5066288&goback=, group_name:-Big Data & Biology, no_of_members:-923, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/p/7/005/052/177/122ae74.png, group_id:-5066288, group_description:-An entire human genome can be sequenced in less than 24 hours. The interpretation of genetic finding however can take a lot longer. Why is it so? What can be done to accelerate the clinical interpretation of whole genome sequencing? Bioninformatics discussions and postings of scripts that automate NGS data analysis highly welcome! Likewise, feel free to post discussions about biology and medicine in the big data context. <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=3784093&goback=, group_name:-Bioinformatics [Bio-IT World], no_of_members:-4081, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/p/3/000/097/3ab/2c8de11.png, group_id:-3784093, group_description:-Bio-IT World focuses on the technologies deployed and strategic decisions made by companies in these areas, and their impact on performance. This group will focus on all things bioinformatics, including databases/data warehousing (biological/public/private/genomic), epigenetics, emerging genomics technologies, general strategies to integrate information for translational studies, and biomarker discovery. <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=12047431&goback=, group_name:-Community.4U, no_of_members:-43, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/AAEAAQAAAAAAAArZAAAAJDUxOWZhNDg0LTk1YTItNGUyOS04ZDhlLTBhNDEyMmQ3MDZiMA.png, group_id:-12047431, group_description:-Axiogenesis is a German biotech company specializing in the production of iPSC-derived cardiomyocytes and neurons as well as CRO services around those products for safety pharmacology/toxicology, in vitro, pre-clinical assays. The purpose of Community.4U is to create a community for Axiogenesis users, collaborators, partners and employees. Here we can share about the latest news, advances, concerns or anything else related to Axiogenesis and your work with us. We want this platform to be useful in improving communication between the company and those we serve. Axiogenesis has an extensive network of professionals both in-house and with collaborating partner companies so we'll do our best to answer any questions you might have concerning your research. Thank you for working with Axiogenesis if you already do and if not we look forward to discussing more about your research and how we can help! <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=1471527&goback=, group_name:-Computational Biology Group, no_of_members:-3565, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/p/2/000/017/15a/0a94997.png, group_id:-1471527, group_description:-Computational Biology (CB) is the application of information technology to the field of molecular biology. CB entails the creation and advancement of databases, algorithms, computational and statistical techniques, and theory to solve formal and practical problems arising from the management and analysis of biological data. Over the past few decades rapid developments in genomic and other molecular research technologies combined developments in information technologies have combined to produce a tremendous amount of information related to molecular biology. It is the name given to these mathematical and computing approaches used to glean understanding of biological processes. Common activities in CB include mapping and analyzing DNA and protein sequences, aligning different DNA and protein sequences to compare them and creating and viewing 3-D models of protein structures. CB is that branch of life science,which deals with the study of application of information technology to the field of molecular biology. The primary goal of CB is to increase our understanding of biological processes. What sets it apart from other approaches, however, is its focus on developing and applying computationally intensive techniques (e.g., data mining, and machine learning algorithms) to achieve this goal. Major research efforts in the field include sequence alignment, gene finding, genome assembly, protein structure alignment, protein structure prediction, high content screening data management, prediction of gene expression and protein-protein interactions, and the modeling of evolution. <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=4831669&goback=, group_name:-DKFZ Career Network, no_of_members:-2170, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/AAEAAQAAAAAAAA2oAAAAJDVhYzlkYzVmLTlkYTQtNDY2OS1hYjZlLWY5M2E0MmM0OGRiNw.png, group_id:-4831669, group_description:-This group is an exclusive platform for current and former dkfz scientists and employees. We encourage members to post links to job offers at their institutes and companies. The dkfz Career Service aims to support all Masters, PhD students and Postdocs in this network in the planning of their professional future. This group is thus exclusively for people with a DKFZ affiliation on their profile. We warmly invite all interested to follow the institute page for more information about the DKFZ: www.linkedin.com/company/dkfz---german-cancer-research-center. If you have any questions please contact careers@dkfz.de. <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=2361575&goback=, group_name:-Data Mining Research And Bioinformatics, no_of_members:-1432, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/p/1/000/036/0b4/2eb032d.png, group_id:-2361575, group_description:-The goal of this community is to interact state-of-the-art techniques in biological data mining and data management and includes topics such as: - preprocessing tasks such as data cleaning and data integration as applied to biological data - classification and clustering techniques for microarrays - comparison of RNA structures based on string properties and energetics - discovery of the sequence characteristics of different parts of the genome - mining of haplotypes to find disease markers - sequencing of events leading to the folding of a protein - inference of the subcellular location of protein activity - classification of chemical compounds based on structure - special purpose metrics and index structures for phylogenetic applications - a new query language for protein searching based on the shape of proteins - very fast indexing schemes for sequences and pathways Aimed at computer scientists, necessary biology is explained. <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=1907365&goback=, group_name:-Discovery on Target, no_of_members:-1552, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/AAEAAQAAAAAAAAvjAAAAJDY2NjdiZDdmLTE3NGYtNGZiMy04NTVmLWY1ODcwNjllMzBlNw.png, group_id:-1907365, group_description:-Cambridge Healthtech Institute will host its 15th Annual Discovery on Target event showcasing current and emerging hot targets for the pharmaceutical industry September 26-28, 2017 in Boston, MA. 2016 Summary: The event attracted 1,200+ attendees (from 21 countries), composed of scientists/technologists, executives, directors, and managers from biopharma, academic, and healthcare organizations. In 2016, the event was comprised of 17 conference tracks, 6 Symposia, 12 short courses, 35+ interactive breakout discussion groups, an exhibit hall of 65 companies, 200+ Speakers and dedicated poster viewing and networking sessions. <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=2435280&goback=, group_name:-Network Pharmacology, no_of_members:-470, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/p/2/000/03f/148/0455068.png, group_id:-2435280, group_description:-Network pharmacology is an approach to drug design and evaluation that encompasses systems biology, network analysis, connectivity, redundancy and pleiotropy. Network pharmacology offers a new way of thinking about drug discovery that embraces simultaneous efforts to improve clinical efficacy and understand side effects and toxicitytwo of the most important reasons for failure. <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=159027&goback=, group_name:-Systems Biology, no_of_members:-15662, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/p/3/000/00e/008/1e0ca80.png, group_id:-159027, group_description:-Created in August 2008, the systems biology group aims at bringing people together who are working in the areas of genomics, proteomics, metabolomics, bioinformatics and relevant fields. A public discussion forum will soon be available for the members to post questions, news or messages of interest
linkedin_projects: number_of_project_members:-0, project_title:-Annotating Signaling Networks: Mode of signal-flow, project_start_date:-2015, project_end_date:-2015, project_description:-I have developed a method to predict mode of signal-flow based on the correlated post-translational modification (PTM) sites. We applied the method to analyze phospho-proteomic datasets and showed that the correlation among phosphosites predicts kinase-substrate relationships (Sopko et al., Dev Cell, 2014). <> number_of_project_members:-0, project_title:-Applying Signaling Networks: Network control and human diseases, project_url:-http://www.flyrnai.org/DirectedNetwork/, project_start_date:-2015, project_end_date:-2015, project_description:-In collaboration with Barabasis group, I have analyzed the controllability of human directed PPI network and identified ~20% of the proteins are indispensable from control perspective (Vinayagam et al., PNAS, 2016). Interestingly, these proteins are highly enriched for disease-causing mutations, targeted by human viruses and targets of FDA approved drugs, suggesting their importance in driving the system from healthy- to disease-state and vice-versa. We showed that network control could be a powerful tool to identify new disease gene and novel drug targets. <> number_of_project_members:-0, project_title:-Building Signaling Networks: MAPK, Hippo, Insulin and Hedgehog, project_start_date:-2010, project_end_date:-2015, project_description:-In collaboration with experimental biologist, I have built networks focused on signaling pathways such as MAPK (Sci Signal, 2011a; Sci Signal, 2011b), Hippo (Science, 2013), Insulin/Akt (Cell Rep, 2016) and Hedgehog (Cell Rep, 2014) pathways. To build these networks, I have integrated large-scale PPI screens (yeast-two hybrid or affinity purification-mass spectrometry), RNAi screens, phospho-proteome and miRNA-target screens from human and Drosophila. We have applied these networks to identify novel regulators of signaling pathways, specifically we found: 	Novel regulators of MAPK signaling pathway in human (Vinayagam, Stelzl., et al., Sci Signal, 2011) and Drosophila (Friedman et al., Sci Signal, 2011) 	Dynamic regulation of Insulin signaling by cancer related protein complexes (Vinayagam, Kulkarni et al., under review) 	Novel regulatory role of endocytosis complexes in Hippo signaling (Kwon, Vinayagam et al., Science, 2013) 	Physiological and non-physiological miRNA targets in Hedgehog signaling (Kim, Vinayagam et al., Cell Rep, 2014) <> number_of_project_members:-0, project_title:-Annotating Signaling Networks: Sign of signal-flow, project_url:-http://www.flyrnai.org/SignedPPI/, project_start_date:-2011, project_end_date:-2014, project_description:-I have developed a computational framework to predict signs of signal-flow (activation/inhibition relationships) by integrating RNAi screen data and PPI networks (Vinayagam et al., Nat Methods, 2013). Using this method I constructed a Drosophila signed PPI network, consisting of 6,125 interactions connecting 3,352 proteins. We applied this network to identify and experimentally validate 8 novel positive and negative regulators of the proteasome complex. This includes an unexpected role for the metabolic enzymes enolase and aldo-keto reductase as positive and negative regulators of proteolysis, respectively. <> number_of_project_members:-0, project_title:-Annotating Signaling Networks: protein complexes and its application to mine high-throughput datasets, project_url:-http://www.flyrnai.org/compleat/, project_start_date:-2011, project_end_date:-2013, project_description:-I have established the largest repository of protein complexes available to date for human, mouse, Drosophila, C. elegans and S. cerevisiae, and developed a tool, the protein complex enrichment analysis tool (COMPLEAT), to analyze high-throughput datasets using this protein complex resource (Vinayagam et al., Sci Signal, 2013). We applied COMPLEAT to analyze: 	Gene knockout screens (Neumuller et al., Sci Signal, 2013) 	RNAi screens (Vinayagam et al., Sci Signal, 2013; Yan et al., Dev Cell, 2014) 	PPI datasets (Kwon et al., Science, 2013; Vinayagam et al., under review) 	Proteomics datasets (Lee et al., in preparation) <> number_of_project_members:-0, project_title:-Annotating Signaling Networks: Direction of signal-flow, project_url:-http://stke.sciencemag.org/content/vol4/issue189/cover.dtl, project_start_date:-2008, project_end_date:-2010, project_description:-I have developed a computational tool, based on Nave Bayesian classifier, to predict the direction of signal-flow among interacting proteins (whether signal flows from A to B or vice-versa ) (Vinayagam et al., Sci Signal, 2011). Using this tool, I constructed the largest human directed PPI network available to date, connecting 6,339 proteins through 32,706 directed edges. We applied flow-based network analysis to identify and experimentally validate 18 novel regulators of the MAPK signaling pathway.

exp_summary1: Develop and apply pathway and network-based approaches to identify novel drug targets
exp_summary4: 1)	Developed a protein-complex based analysis framework for high-thoughput (omics) datasets 2)	Developed a computational method to predicted signs (activation/inhibitory relationship) in protein-protein interaction networks 3)	Characterized the controllability of cellular signaling networks by combining directed PPI network and control theory
exp_company_name5: Max Delbrck Center for Molecular Medicine (MDC), Berlin, Germany
exp_summary5: 1)	Developed a computational method to predict edge direction in protein-protein interaction networks 2)	Identified modifier SNPs for age-at-onset of Huntington Disease by combining computational and experimental approaches
exp_summary6: 1)	Developed an automated gene function prediction tool by combining machine learning approaches (Support Vector Machines) and Gene Ontology. 2)	Annotated the Xenopus laevis gene functions
exp_company_name8: National Centre for Biological Sciences (NCBS), Bangalore, India
exp_summary8: 1)	Developed a fold-recognition method for small disulfide rich peptides 2)	DSDBASE  a database of native and modeled disulfide bonds in proteins 3)	DDBASE  a structural domain database

exp_summary1: McGroce (abbr. Machine Merchandised Grocery) is an e-commerce Website And Mobile App for Grocery shopping needs. McGroce is one stop destination for all grocery shopping needs making the experience easier and smarter than ever before, delivered from local stores intelligently we employ machine learnng techniques to save on fuel and overall cost. Drives orders to local vendors using shopper's geolocation (hyperlocal) for voice orders.

name: kumar m
headline: Owner, fair films
summary: Hi, This is m.kumar from fair films,chennai,india.. I am an importer and distributor of English and non English films to india and saarc countries. I am always looking for different kinds of feature films for india and saarc countries. My first film to india and saarc countries are X NIGHT OF VENGEANCE. you can see this trailor in www.xthemovie.com.au, my second film for india will be SAINTDRACULA 3D.www.saintdracula3d.com. my third film for india is SUCKER; www.suckerthemovie.com. Now i am doing THE WARLORDS, starring, JEL LEE you can see the trailor in www.warlordsthemovie.com, Currently i did SINISTER ,NON STOP and The; Monkey king 3d, imax etc. i do dubbing for all international languages .for example, Japanese, chinese, Europoen etc.

To have event organizers, venues and contractors work better/closer together and with other relevant associations in our wider marketplace to drive industry revenues, share overhead costs and increase intellectual input/output in order to grow our industry. 2. To create one strong industry voice. 3. To increase resources for industry promotion. 4. To achieve swift and constructive action regarding common industry issues. 5. To increase industry professionalism and knowledge amongst member companies. 6. To educate the business community as to the value of event marketing, and how their businesses can maximize their use of the medium. 7. To engineer a place alongside other media marketing agencies within the mindset of brands and advertising agencies. 8. To position events as increasingly relevant to the way business interactions and consumer lifestyles are conducted today. Brands and customers want face-to-face engagement and experiences. 9. To eradicate the need for the why events? argument from members sales and marketing activities with seminars and conferences for the industry. 10. To create an environment which proactively encourages the recruitment of quality people into our industry ! These could include reference checks, standardizing salary structures etc. 11. To create a network of businesses dedicated to providing outstanding products and services for all event-planning needs. Introducing latest technology and ideas form around the world. 12. To increasing business and create new opportunities for members through networking events organized in various locations across India. 13. To provide excellent, money saving co-op advertising and marketing opportunities. Participate in forums and discussions. <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=3451751&goback=, group_name:-Government in the Cognitive Era, no_of_members:-34626, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/AAEAAQAAAAAAAASPAAAAJGZlODhmNmM1LTBiODUtNGRlZS1hOGVhLTAzNTBlNjAwNWNlMQ.png, group_id:-3451751, group_description:-Improving the lives of citizens, meeting elevated demands for service and enhancing economic vitality are just some of the challenges government and leaders face in the data driven economy. Challenges around how to increase efficiency, deliver enhanced citizen services and improve programs outcomes have always existed, but the technology available now gives leaders in all industries, including government the ability to augment human capabilities, in uncovering insights, predicting outcomes and making evidence based decisions at scale and at speed. The cognitive era will transform the way government agencies operate, enabling them to deepen the engagement with citizens and interactions can be personalized and tailored to the needs of the individual. Government in the Cognitive Era is the place where conversations between thought leaders, inspiring thinkers and city officials and governments around the globe are encouraged. It is a place where people can connect to share ideas and explore how to make the way we live and work better. Together we can discover ways in which the organizations across the globe focused on citizen-centric services can use technology to help decipher all the data to address the challenges of today and prepare for tomorrow. We will be posting case studies, white papers, interviews and a whole raft of materials that show the efforts being made along the cognitive journey for companies, industries, and governments as they develop digital strategies that deploy analytics, cloud, mobile, security, Internet of Things to address their challenges head on - turning data into insights, enhancing program outcomes, mitigating threats and most importantly improving the quality of life for the citizens and communities they serve. This group is managed by Angela Warner, Tisha Loftus, Rakesh Ravindran, Anca Nichita, Raluca Georgiana Popa and follows the IBM Social Computing Guidelines. <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=6785239&goback=, group_name:-CIO Digital Foundation, no_of_members:-401, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/AAEAAQAAAAAAAAUZAAAAJDRjMWQyNDdkLThiYmItNDhjMC1hMmQ1LWNhOTFjNzBiOTdkMw.png, group_id:-6785239, group_description:-Its an innovative concept addressing the challenges, industry and senior leaders of IT have been facing in today's market and economy. <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=1792574&goback=, group_name:-CIO Leadership Board, no_of_members:-2638, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/p/3/000/01b/337/1f87ee2.png, group_id:-1792574, group_description:-CIO Leadership Board is an exclusive group dedicated to current IT senior executives in diverse industries. Our mission is to build trusted relationships, share thoughts, enable collaboration, introduce best practices & innovations, discuss strategies and initiatives, resolve IT issues, seek opportunities and connect with like-minded peers. We encourage you to join our exclusive group and interact in our private and informative discussions. To qualify, you must be or have been a CIO, CTO, CSO, CISO, EVP, SVP, VP or held a senior IT management position in your organization. Typically, Membership is by Invitation or Peer Referral. If you meet the above qualification, please feel free to apply. Membership approval and acceptance are not guaranteed. <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=8289267&goback=, group_name:-ISB Big Leap - Powering SMEs & Startups for Growth, no_of_members:-62, group_id:-8289267, group_description:-ISB Big Leap is a premier platform for Businesses - SMEs & Start-ups. name: Ram Manohar Bokkisa
headline: Digital Analytics Consultant  Adobe Certified Expert  Tag Management Expert
summary: As an Independent Consultant I provide end to end services on Digital Analytics/Tag Management viz., Strategy/Design, Implementation and Reporting & Visualization. I provide one week Pro bono consulting. You can email me at ramnew2006@gmail.com or call me at +91 8939686018 anytime if you want to work with me. Prior to this I worked at Cognizant as a Digital Analytics Consultant and headed Digital Analytics practice at Payoda Technologies. Founded couple of websites prep4civils.com and storygag.com. I write at geekonation.com on Digital Analytics, Social Media, Customer Data Hubs, Tag Management Systems, JavaScript Hacks, Google Script Hacks and Wordpress. I have a Bachelors and Masters degree from Indian Institute of Technology Madras (Fun Fact: IIT Madras has ranked at the top in the latest MHRD rankings on Engineering colleges). Skills: Tag Management Solutions (Ensighten, Tealium, Google Tag Manager, Adobe Dynamic Tag Management), Digital Analytics Solution design & Implementation (Adobe Analytics / SiteCatalyst / Omniture, IBM CoreMetrics, Google Analytics, WebTrends), Data Visualization (Google Data Studio, MS Excel), Data Management Platforms (Tealium AudienceStream, Adobe Audience Manager), JavaScript, jQuery, PhantomJS, CasperJS, HTML, CSS, PHP, MATLAB, Introductory Machine Learning Techniques. Certified in Adobe Reports and Analytics Implementation ACE (Adobe Certified Expert) Certified in Adobe Analytics Processing Rules Google Analytics Individual Qualification Ensighten Certified Professional for Manage

exp_summary1: I provide end to end Digital analytics & Tag Management services which include - Requirement Analysis - Strategy/Solution design - Implementation - Reporting & Data Visualization I have 6 years of professional experience in working with Clients from different domains including Banking & Finance, Insurance, Life Sciences, Health Care, Retail, Consumer Goods and Media & Publishing. Some of the clients I worked for earlier are Staples, HEB, AstraZeneca, Mattel, Abbvie, Baxter, Local World, RSA etc. I have a flexible working model and I provide one week of Pro Bono consulting. You can contact me at ramnew2006@gmail.com
exp_summary2: I write on Digital Analytics, Tag Management, WordPress, JavaScript Hacks, Google Script Hacks and other interesting web related stuff.
exp_summary3: Headed the Digital Analytics Business Unit  Took care of Digital Marketing & Analytics Services Delivery and worked closely with the Sales team  Built innovative tools which solved the pain points in Digital Marketing & Analytics area
exp_summary4: StoryGAG.com is an online channel for curated content related to diverse fields where the users can spend their time reading these interesting articles. The single aim behind StoryGAG is to become one of the best websites for curated content without any boundaries to the content category.
exp_summary5: Apart from being a Digital Analytics consultant,  Managed 8 people, taking care of their project and human resources needs  Led the Knowledge Management team for Cognizant Digital Analytics team  SME(Subject Matter Expert) for Ensighten, Tealium and IBM Coremetrics
exp_summary6: I started writing about my thoughts, learning and the trends of Web Analytics industry, Web Analytics tools and Tag Management Systems on this blog (http://www.onlywebanalytics.com) while I started it. Later I have moved on to a new website (http://geekonation.com) where I currently blog about Digital Analytics, Tag Management and also WordPress & other Web related stuff.
exp_summary7: As a Web Analytics Expert in Digital Analytics division of Cognizant Interactive, I was part of various POCs, Client RFPs, Web Analytics Project Estimates apart from being a Web Analytics solution design and implementation engineer. As a Web Analytics Engineer I was involved in  A WebTrends and MRM Database Reporting project for a Life Sciences Client which involved extensive Data Analysis and Visualization  Tag Management System implementation (Tealium) with IBM Coremetrics as the data collection tool for a Consumer Goods client for two of their large ecommerce sites and multiple engagement sites  Adobe SiteCatalyst Traditional Implementation for large number of B2B and B2C sites of a Life Sciences Client  Adobe SiteCatalyst implementation using Ensighten (Tag Management System) for a Consumer Goods client for their ecommerce website  Worked for a Large Retail client for their group of ecommerce websites on Adobe SiteCatalyst implemention, also other Marketing tools like Criteo, Certona, Google Remarketing, Responsys implementation using Ensighten TMS.
exp_summary8: Prep4Civils.com was started with an intention to become biggest and best online resource for Civil services preparation. It was a great experience working for the thing I loved. I did a whole lot of things which included 1. Initiated the development with basic Wordpress site. 2. Designed and customized the whole website using PHP, MySQL, HTML & CSS and added Social Networking features. 3. Carried out various performance analysis of the website on SEO grounds Implemented exhaustive Search Engine Optimization (SEO) measures. 4. Led and managed a team of 10 members who were technical writers. 5. Implemented Google Analytics framework for the whole website and created a number of custom reports. 6. Successfully marketed official Facebook fan page which has attracted over 1600 fans so far. On the whole it was a very educative and fun experience working on Prep4Civils.
exp_summary9: Had a short 2 month intern at GMR Infra division which was working on the Outer Ring Road near Poonamalle in Chennai. As part of the program I did the scheduling for the Interchange on NH-45 and compared the results with the Master scheduling that was done before.
honor_summary1: Cognizant Analytics has given me the Going Extra Mile (GEM) Annual award for 2014.
honor_summary2: I was awarded the "Associate of the Quarter" for the performance in a Life Sciences project
honor_summary3: I was ranked 681 in the State Level Engineering entrance exam for Andhra Pradesh out of more than 140,000 Students appeared.
honor_issuer4: Andhra Pradesh Association of Mathematics Teachers
honor_summary4: I was one of the toppers in State Level Mathematics Olympiad conducted for +2 Level by AP Mathematics Teachers Association
honor_summary5: I was ranked 5th in the Andhra Pradesh State in +1 Board Examination
honor_summary6: I stood 1st in the Talent Search Examination conducted by Guntur Vikas Junior College in Hyderabad district.
honor_title6: District Topper in Talent Search Examination
honor_summary7: I stood second in the talent search examination conducted by Geetanjali Talent School across Hyderabad city.

headline: Systems Engineering, Virtualization, Cloud Architecture, Design & Enterprise Data Storage Technologies
summary: Summary: . Amazon AWS architect . 15+ years of IT experience, including VMware server/desktop/application virtualization and Storage technology experience and certifications in VMware/Citrix/EMC/NetApp (7-Mode & C-Mode)/HItachi VSP/IBM/Pillar/HP Storage/Dell Storage hardware and software. Extensive experience with SAN/NAS/iSCSI/CIFS, VTLs, Backup/Recovery, D/R architecture, design, implementation and troubleshooting. Experience in VMware, Virtual Center, VMotion, DRS, Clustering, P2V convertor, View, vCloud Director, Health Analyzer, vRealize, Citrix XenDesktop/XenApp .vBlock & Flexpod, Cisco UCS Director/Cloupia cloud management and various tools .Unidesk integration with VDI for OS/Application/Personalisation layers Hardware & Software Skills: . Cisco UCS, VCE, Flexpod architecture, HP C7000 . VMware, Citrix, Hyper-V EMC Symmetrix / DMX, vMAX, VNX, Unity, NetApp Filers, HP Storage, Hitachi VSP, Hitachi HNAS, Pillar, Dell, 3PAR, PureStorage, Nimble Brocade and Cisco fibre-channel & distance switching platforms. EMC SRDF NetApp SnapMirror, SnapManager SMSQL, SMVI, SnapVault, OnCommand core, Balance, OCI, SME. EMC Avamar DeDuplication, ControlCenter, SymmOptimizer, Performance Manager, StorageScope, SAN Manager, SAN Advisor, Replication Manager, RecoverPoint, Legato, and PowerPath. Dell, HP C7000, IBM, Cisco Enterprise and blade servers. Symantec Storage Foundations for Windows, NetBackup, Backpexec, CommandCentral Storage, AvePoint and CommVault. Quantum, Data Domain FalconStor Veeam Replication, DoubleTake high availability for Disaster Recovery, Zerto for D/R Platespin PortabilitySuite, Forge, DoubleTake for P2V, P2P, V2V and V2P D/R migrations. Unidesk .Cloud automation through Cisco vCloud Director Specialties: SAN/NAS/iSCSI/VMware/Microsoft/Cisco/Linux/Backup&Archiving expertise. Expert in designing, architecting and implenting Disaster Recovery, Business Continuity and High availability. vBlock, Flexpod Cloud automation through Cloupia

exp_summary1: Architect Private/Public Cloud engineering solutions.
exp_title2: Sr. Virtualization/Storage Architect/Design and Implementation Consultant
exp_summary2: Architect/Design/Implement Virtualization Technologies involving VMware (vSphere, VDI, SRM, vCloud Director, Orchestrator, Chargeback, vShield), Citrix (Xenserver, XenDesktop 7.6), Microsoft (AD, SQL, RemoteApp and Remote Desktop services, Hyper-V) Advanced level expertise in Storage Technologies such as EMC, NetApp (7-Mode, C-Mode), HP, Dell, Hitachi, Pillar Data Systems, FalconStor, Tiger NAS, Windows iSCSI Storage, IBM Storage, Sun Storage, LSI, Nimble, Nutanix. Comprehensive data center management and data migration expertise local and across Cloud. Strategic Consulting, Partnership with vendors, Consulting Organizations including business plan & sales strategy development. Storage & Backup Technology (NetBackup, EMC Networker, Commvault, Veeam, Phd esXpress, DataDomain, Avamar) Network & Server Management (Computing Cisco UCS, HP, Dell, IBM, Nutanix) Security Management (Vulnerability scanners expertise) Data Migrations & Upgrades .Cloud Automation through Cisco UCS Director
exp_summary3: Data Center Migration VMware, HP C7000, Cisco UCSp Variety of Enterprise Data Storage State of the Art Technologies, the Best in class!!
exp_summary4: Architecture, Design, Implementation and operations support of FlexPod environment running VMware, Cisco UCS (B-Series, C-Series), storage NetApp Cluster mode at multiple data centers. Implemented Citrix XenDesktop 7.6, maintained security, supported Windows/Linux/SQL DB, applications and Commvault (SnapProtect), as a backup solution. Safenet to encrypt storage and numerous monitoring, performance gathering tools. Data center consolidation.
exp_summary5: Architect, design and implement converged Flexpod environment across various data centers managing hundreds of critical production servers running Mortgage related applications. Built and maintained hundreds of Windows/Linux, MSSQL 2008/2012 databases, designed backup and business continuity solution for business critical applications performing test D/R drills often. Maintained petabytes of NetApp 7-Mode and C-Mode storage, utilized various tools to manage snapshots related to backup, replication and archival for long term. Automated enterprise Cloud across various data centers by implementing Cisco UCS Director (Cloupia) by integrating VMware, Storage, Networking for VM provisioning, automated application installation. Performed Several terabytes of data migration across data centers to consolidate sites, data migration across private and public cloud. Performed Cisco UCS, NetApp firmware upgrade and upgrade of VMware vCenter, vSphere across various data centers. Performed hardware/software installation keeping up cloud to the latest version as per Interop. Managed day to day operational activities, assessing application performance, VMware/Storage capacity on regular basis.
exp_summary6: Architect/Design/Implement Virtualization/Storage & Cloud technologies. I was part of the acquisition of 4Base Technology by CA Technologies.
exp_title7: Sr. Virtualization Consultant (CA Inc acquired 4Base Tech)
exp_title8: Senior VMware /Storage Engineer (VCP5.x, EMC Professionaly proven, NetApp NCDA/NCIE certified)
exp_summary8: Independent Consultant related to Data Center Virtualization having expertise in various Virtualization technologies and variety of Storage technologies!!
exp_title9: Senior Storage Engineer (INX Inc acquired AccessFlow)
exp_summary9: Leading VMware Virtualization company AccessFlow has been acquired by a leading Cisco networking solution company INX Inc.
exp_summary10: Designing, Engineering and implementing Storage area networking technology, Databases, various Operating Systems..
exp_summary11: Programming and Quality analysis of IBM's Tivoli Storage Manager Backup/Recovery data software formerly known as ADSM (Adstar Data Storage Manager), worked at San Jose, California.
exp_summary12: Designing and fabricating memory chips working in photo-lithography Hi-Tech clean room FAB.
exp_summary13: Worked as a production engineer/supervisor in machine shop manufacturing Ford tractor equipments.

name: saitej pisupati
headline: Student at narayana
summary: I believe that all art can be captured at the intersection of photography and design. I am on the lookout for opportunities which would enable me to put my creative skills to use and expose me to other verticals in creative fields. RHCA exams discuss advanced topics in several areas of Linux administration. For more information about RHCA, please visit the following link: http://www.redhat.com/certification/rhca/ There are many reasons behind creating such a group, some of them are: RHCA training is costly and not affordable for many, lack of 3rd party books, RHCA is not popular yet, lack of Red Hat training in some countries, etc.... because of these reasons preparing for RHCA is not an easy task and requires lots of efforts. exp_summary1: Profit & Loss Accountability  Site Management  Multi Site Operations Management  Organizational Development  Contract Negotiation  Land Development  Project Management  Budgeting & Cost Containment  Product Development & Launch  Client Satisfaction  Mentoring Team
exp_summary2: 1. Mena Aerospace Facility  New Taxiway-Code E. Project with 2 Hangers for 757 and office buildings with NFPA 409 compliance. 2. Al Baraka Bank Building (4B+P+G+7)at Bahrain Bay(Contractor: Arabtec)
exp_company_name3: Mechanical Contracting and Services Company W.L.L.
exp_summary3: BANAGAS  Compression Station 9(including infrastructural works) & Blast Resistant Ctrl. Room Bldg. (EPC Project) (Main Contractor: Japan Gulf (JGC))
exp_summary4: Bahrain Bay Infrastructure
exp_company_name5: Hyder Consulting Engineers Middle East Ltd
exp_summary5: - Supervision of all civil works related to the infrastructure works with site inspectors and surveyor. - Supervision of water transmission works including different types of chambers, like valve chambers, air valve chambers, washout chambers, thrust blocks, anchor blocks (horizontal & vertical bends), above ground pipe supports, telemetry ducts with draw pit chambers. Lay of ductile iron pipelines of 800/600/400/250mm diameter & UPVC pipelines. DI 2x1000mm Dia., water lines crossing. - Supervision of all utilities, (relocation of existing along with construction of new lines) drainage, electrical cables (HV & LV), sewer line etc. Co-ordinate, with client's engineering department for modification of construction drawing day to day. Co-ordinate with all utilities, conducting meetings to identifying and resolve the problems in advance. - Prepare traffic diversions and approvals or correct and presenting with clarity to traffic engineering department for proposed traffic diversion of contractor. - Get relocation and realignment of services if needed through various utility authorities. - Conduct meetings with contractor weekly and monthly for progress and identifying and reminding about their task to achieve. - Monitor day to day activities comparing to the actual schedule and reporting to the Senior Resident Engineer. - Studying the method statement provided by the contractor, if need allow contractor to correct according the specification required way to maintaining the quality.
exp_summary6: - Co-ordinate with all size of Road Works for different ministries and other government bodies like Bahrain University, Ministry of Education, Ministry of Housing, BAPCO, BANAGAS and BDF other clients etc., - Attend meeting with Client and Consultants for clarification in design and other relative to avoid confusion in execution of jobs. - Tender the jobs, Estimate, Reconciliation after job handing over and analysis the project profitability. Advising the staff how to carry out the job efficiently and to achieve expected quality of the Client or Consultants.
exp_summary7: Handled various assignments of Civil & Road Works for Ministry of Work & Housing; Ministry of Electricity & Water; Ministry of Education; CMC; Ministry of Health; Ministry of Interior; Bahrain Defence Force; National guards; Alba; GPIC; Bapco and a host of private jobs. Estimating the Projects from the drawing or sketches provided by the client / consultant as per the design and the existing levels. All computation done on Excel spread sheet. All Pre-contract and Post-contract works. Preparing month end valuations for the all jobs or Projects along with the calculation sheets & sketches. Preparing reconciliation sheet for every job and ensuring that responsible staff receives all the necessary details and which sets a limitation of the material request of orders. At every stage keep the management fully informed about the progress of the projects and incorporates their suggestions at the site. Preparation; of quotations / inventory for audit purpose and necessary formalities required for insurance. Provide the client / consultant the required data sheet for approval. Prepare request for approved material and arranging material as per required specifications of in time for approved. Arranging weekly meeting with all staff members for scheduling for on-going and forth-coming jobs / projects.
exp_summary8: Project Name: Hidd Power & Water Production Facility Duties and Responsibilities: Handle different activities such as QA/QC Engineer maintaining the testing report for utility services and concrete works, as Site Engineer (supervision of all related civil works such as drainage works, duct banks and sewer works), Quantity Surveyor as well as drawings section in-charge in Hidd Power and Water Production Facility Phase 1. Responsible for construction of Desalination Plant and associated structures Civil Works  Liaison with Fisia Italimpianti & MSCEB Consultants, Bahrain. Involved in all buildings (Admn. & Communication, Electro-chlorination, LV Switchgear etc.) in Hidd Water Production Facility.
exp_summary9: - For Shampoo Factory collaborated with Haldir Ltd, England for united Products in industrial City of Jeddah, which is just like Pharmaceutical industries or Hospital in its hygiene, includes production building, warehouse, Admin. Bldg. Etc. and some other for the same client for Jeddah Graphic Centre too. - Extension for SOFAB LOCKS & HANDLES FACTORY works, Production Bldg., Guardroom, Main entrance, Installation of underground diesel tank, fire alarm and firefighting system, car park, duct bank for power distribution for 4 factories relating same client M/S SHAMSAN CO. Ind. City. - For same client handled another project  Shamsans Labour housing G+2 Building with 72 Rooms. - In (Sheratons) ATTALLAHS HAPPY LAND extension works. - Consultant for civil works for Nova Adualucia villas. Compounds, which include Swimming Pool, Recreation Bldg., etc. - For civil works in SABICs PROJECT in Yambu at Ibn-Rushd, Arabian Industrial Fibers. For a new Products Warehouse site of area 80 x 140 m2 with Butler Pre-engineered Building, with all facilities, including firefighting system including sprinklers. Reporting with statistical progress reports to the representatives of the client. Project handed over within time with at most satisfaction of the client.
exp_summary10: - In ADNOCS Ruwais Housing Complex for Renovation & External Painting Works, with 5 supervisors and 200 Labours. Under a coordinator Mr. Veeraswamy and General Manager Mr. Abid Junaid.
exp_summary11: An extension of RCC based conduction furnaces and additional building, for micro grit plant.
exp_summary12: Executing building works, survey planning and organizing sub-staff, skilled and unskilled workers.

The FINANCE CLUB focusses on helping finance professionals to grow their industry network, enhance their career and close more deals. Join us, if you are working in the following industries: Accounting Banking Capital Markets Financial Services Insurance Investment Banking Investment Management Real Estate Venture Capital Private Equity Benefits of group members: + CONNECT with other finance professionals from all over the world + FIND the next finance job or employee + LEARN from and participate in finance discussions + NETWORKING events will be organized in major cities (i.e. London, New York, Frankfurt) + INDUSTRY and LOCAL subgroups will help you further Join the Finance Club now, it is free. <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=39259&goback=, group_name:-Finance Plus: Private Equity, Venture Capital and M&A News, no_of_members:-577347, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/AAEAAQAAAAAAAA13AAAAJDAyMmMwNTExLTE0ZmItNGZjMi05MGM5LTBlNTgyYzA5MjU4Mw.png, group_id:-39259, group_description:-The FinancePlus group serves financial and investment managers for all types of businesses: from small and medium sized businesses to listed companies and financial services such as investment boutiques and investment banks. FinancePlus is an information service for investment and finance professionals worldwide with over 950,000 members in its various groups including Accounting & Audit Group, Chief Financial Officer  CFO, Private Equity Networking, Mergers and Acquisitions - M&A, and TechPlus. FinancePlus also owns more than a dozen country related Forums including Hungary Forum, Poland Forum, Russia Forum and Ukraine Connections. Current market conditions require that investment and financial professionals look more broadly for synergies with their own mission and goals. They require a means to an overview of real opportunities in the global environment and to obtain meaningful business and background information. FinancePlus is an answer to this need. We invite you to join us to develop this new menu of services for investors. FinancePlus is also seeking to build an Internet-based Deal Book of blind profiles for access by professional investors  company sales, private equity and venture capital, block share sales, buy searches, project finance and bridge finance. <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=3814519&goback=, group_name:-FINTECH (Financial Technology) Professional Network, no_of_members:-184396, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/AAEAAQAAAAAAAAlcAAAAJGQzODJkZDhmLTkzM2UtNGYwNC1hZmI5LTVhYmEyNzE4MDAyNA.png, group_id:-3814519, group_description:-Biggest Financial Technology (FINTECH) group on Linkedin is open to all professionals and executives. name: Vaibhav Ganesan
headline: Project Engineer at Petrofac
summary: I am an experienced Project Engineer at one of the leading EPC (Engineering, Procurement & Construction) organizations. In my current role, I have an opportunity to work with the Head of department, Piping to manage over 300 personnel, management processes and business outcomes. Prior to this, I've done my Masters in Petroleum Engineering from Heriot Watt University, Edinburgh. An overview of my responsibilities are below: 	Leadership o	Successfully trained and lead small teams to perform the necessary quality checks on 3-D model o	Provide advice in operational domain of specialization to special project teams o	Management of routine operational activities of the department that tie back to departmental mission and vision 	Communication: o	Handled internal communication activities for the department o	Responsible to handle executive communications for the Head of department Coordination: o	Coordinating between multi-disciplines and ensuring deliverance of a high quality 3-D model o	Coordinating between a team of 30 checkers and designers to ensure deliverance of piping deliverables as per schedule 	Problem solving: o	Independently generates solutions based on analytical skills and business knowledge o	Challenge the validity of given procedures and processes to enhance and improve or develop complementary adjustments / solutions 	Impact on business: o	Contributes to activities that are subject to business measurements & customer satisfaction o	Assist in overall departmental planning with budgetary responsibility Eg: Assisting Head of department in man-power resource allocation and man-hour estimate for operational activities o	Created review / feedback process and controls that feed to management systems across the department I believe that my significant exposure to the three main facets (Upstream, Middlestream-EPC and Downstream) of the Oil Industry will hold me good stead in my quest to become a domain expert.

linkedin_projects: number_of_project_members:-0, project_title:-Directional Survey and Anti-Collision Management, project_start_date:-2013-7, project_end_date:-2013-8, project_description:-Analysed the different existing anti-collision equipment and measures The different deployment techniques were examined Used a case study to calculate the best surveying methods Economically proved the need for an effective anti-collision management system to be thoroughly implemented Recommended the use of a new technology (Gyro-While-Drilling) after analysing all aspects of the tool Published an SPE Paper under the title Directional Surveying and Anti-Collision Risk Management <> number_of_project_members:-0, project_title:-Field Development Proposal for an Oil and Gas field in the North Sea, project_start_date:-2013-5, project_end_date:-2013-6, project_description:-The reservoir properties and characteristics were determined using logs, core data and seismic data. The Techlogs software was used extensively to help interpret the sonic, resistivity and neutron-density logs The fluid properties and mobility ratios were determined after analysing the PVT data and performing the fractional flow curve analysis STOIIP and reserves were estimated using Probabilistic and Deterministic methods. The Monte Carlo method was given preference Reservoir Static and Dynamic Models were modelled using Petrel and Eclipse Reservoir simulation was done to decide the optimum number of wells to be drilled and to determine the optimum well placements Formulated a comprehensive drilling programme to ensure maximum pay zone exposure A production programme was formulated to design the surface facilities and narrow down on the optimum production technique Was Head of the Project Economics for the entire project.The different economic parameters of the entire project were calculated and optimized. Created a comprehensive cash flow model after taking into account all the variables. Environmental impact of the project was determined and ensured that the project strives to make sure that there is no adverse impact on the environment Softwares used : Techlogs, Wellflo, Petrel, Eclipse, Questor, Pansystem <> number_of_project_members:-0, project_title:-Design and Analysis of a manual material handling equipment for shop floor purposes, project_start_date:-2012-1, project_end_date:-2012-7, project_description:-The system was designed to lift a load of 250 kg, to a height of 5 feet The system would use a single start worm gear for transmission The key components are a worm gear, base frame, two pulleys, a crane and a wire rope Wheels were provided at the base to enable motions in all directions Designed the model with the help of Autocad, Catia and Ansys softwares <> number_of_project_members:-0, project_title:-Operations of a Refinery (BPCL - Kochi), project_start_date:-2012-7, project_end_date:-2012-7, project_description:-Understood in detail the operations and workings of the various component plants Was taught about all the safety precautions to be taken when moving through the site Prepared a comprehensive report on the various operating units and their functional processes Briefly researched the different petroleum pricing mechanisms followed in India Different CDU units were toured and analyzed

exp_summary1: In addition the responsibilities mentioned in the overview, currently working on a ZADCO Project (UZ750) based in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates Responsible for performing quality checks on the 3-D Model for the entire project and ensuring that clash-free modules are locked and handed over to the client Coordinating with all disciplines and making sure that the Model Review comments and Tags placed by the client are incorporated while designing the 3-D Model Drawing out a comprehensive deliverable schedule for all Pipe racks of the project after consulting all the disciplines Expediting the HOLD list/NEED list of all individual disciplines and ensuring that the discipline deliverables are issued as per schedule Coordinating between site engineers and individual disciplines for resolving all yard queries with respect to module fabrication Performing final quality check on all the individual modules and ensuring that all modeled components are well within the transportation volume to be shipped on barges to the site from the yard Driving the individual disciplines to make sure that all the IFC (Issued for Construction) and Re-IFC as issued as per schedule committed to the Yards and the Client Helped optimize MTO extraction by ensuring that all objects are modeled within their respective production hierarchies Validated weights assigned to piping components, equipments and structural objects. Proper assignment of weights has helped optimize weight and COG calculations for modules
honor_summary1: Nominated by Petrofac, Chennai for the Royal Academy of Engineering 'Global Rising Star Award' for the year 2015-16

name: Vishnu Raj
headline: Senior Analyst at iris Concise
summary: A Decision Sciences/Business Analytics professional with rich experience in data driven problem solving, leading teams & handling clients. A firm believer in constant learning. "Forever evolving & never standing still". Experience in solving real world problems through Business Analytics ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Worked as a business analyst/decision scientist in Mu Sigma with two fortune 500 clients (a technology & services major & an online marketplace)  Experienced in a wide spectrum of work right from BI reporting & dashboarding to predictive analytics  Experience in CRM & Marketing analytics with the technology & services major  Worked with the seller protection team of the online marketplace During my stint at Mu Sigma, I used various techniques viz.  Linear regression  Logistic regression  Decision tree (CHAID)  Exponential smoothing & moving averages (Time Series)  The Master's program in Business Analytics exposed me to many more statistical techniques like ARIMA, Discrete Choice Modeling etc. Softwares known  SAS (SAS Certified Base Programmer)  R (Statistical Tool)  Teradata  Tableau  MS Excel  MS Powerpoint  SPSS My association with TEDx -------------------------------------- I was the organizer of the first two editions of TEDxSRM. And also revived TEDxNUS in 2015. I attended the first TEDxSummit in 2012. This was probably the best international exposure for me as I got to meet people from many countries & with diverse interests, owing to the vast reach of TEDx. Others ---------- In pursuit of exploring journalism, I was part of the Spectrum (in house newsletter of SRM University) team during the Indian Science Congress, 2011.  I was able to get a news bite from Dr. Venkatraman (Nobel Laureate) regarding pursuit of science in a tete-e-tete (and this was the headline in national newspapers the next day) I have also been an emcee in many events.

edu_activities2: TEDxSRM - Organizer | Aaruush Main Quiz 2007 - Organizer | Aaruush Marketing Unconference - Organizing Team Member & Moderator | Quizzing | Emcee | Short film making
exp_summary2: I (along with 3 more students) were instrumental in reviving this event after it being dormant for 4 years I handled the following departments  Sponsorship  Finance  Event logistics
exp_summary3: Post my internship at Jurong Port, I was chosen to imbibe data infused decision making in the organisation.  Spreading the culture of decision making with the help of data  Enabling the management to realize the potential of business analytics
exp_summary4: The final project presentation to the C-suite triggered the managements decision to use analytics as a key focus area for the organisation. Project  Cargo Yield Analysis by Commodity & Throughput Prediction --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Recommended a strategy to increase the revenue by an additional SG$3.3 Million & increase the yield by more than 100%  Built a framework for revenue & cost attribution to various commodities dealt by Jurong Port to compute the yield (by commodity).  Predicted the volume of major share of commodities (cement & steel) handled by the port for the next financial year.  Macro-economic factors were included in the model owing to the relation of these commodities to infrastructural development in Singapore.
exp_summary5: Worked with two Fortune 500 clients (a technology & services major and an online marketplace). Work with the technology major  Worked with the CRM analytics team for Small & Medium Businesses  Weekly performance reports of the Small & Medium Business segment; and drawing insights with regards to the performance against forecasts  Forecast the revenue, profits & number of units sold for a quarter  Determine the opportunity available for the client in the 10 - 5,000 employee size segment of Small & Medium Businesses; to gauge the revenue potential if new customers are acquired  Customer segmentation - developing rules for new customer segments  Predict the next product a customer will buy  Find the audience of an internal sales help portal of the client & also find the type of content being consumed, to gauge the adoption of this portal & thereby help develop this portal Work with the online marketplace  Worked with the trust analytics & incremental GMV (Gross Merchandise Value of the goods being sold on the platform) team. Both are under the Seller Protection team  Built a metric to measure the bad selling experiences on the platform & then a dashboard on tableau to monitor the same & the effect of policies on it; the objective was to protect the sellers from abusive buyers  Helped the client decide whether to buy third party data or not, to identify abusive buyers; analysed the value added by the data from third party & combined it with a cost benefit analysis to take the final decision
exp_summary6: Organised the first two editions of the event (2010 & 2012)  Point of contact for the speakers at the event  Social Media strategy  Public Relations  Overall logistics of the event  Emcee for the 2010 event
exp_summary7: The 2011 edition of Aaruush Main Quiz saw participation from the top B-schools of India for the first time. The 2010 edition of the Main Quiz pulled down the reputation of the event in the Quizzing community. For someone who always liked be on the participating side of quizzing, I took the decision to become the organizer with the sole objective of reviving the reputation of the event. I was among the team of 3 organizers chosen for this event. And we were successful in turning it around to produce a great quiz & developing "Aaruush Main Quiz" as the flagship event for the university fest.
honor_summary1: Exemplary commitment which resulted in client appreciation for Canada Mid Market segmentation. Key Highlight  Project was successfully completed in a short span of time resulting in the client getting appreciation from his seniors. Key Challenge  Handling multiple data sources which didn't sync with each other completely. This project was unsuccessfully attempted by two people from the client's organisation before me. Canada Mid Market segmentation was done for the SMB customers in the Canada region. I formed the base of customers who would go into the new Mid Market segment of customers. This segmentation was key to the client as the client organisation was shifting it's focus to the Mid Market segment.

name: Karthik Deivasigamani
headline: Principal Software Engineer @WalmartLabs
summary: Expertise in processing and categorizing (>5 Million web events per day) in near real time for behavioral targeting of users using Hadoop, MapReduce, Hbase,Oozie on a 20 node cluster.  Handled massive volumes of data (>20Million events per day) and generated analytic metrics using Hadoop, MR, Hbase, Hive for business teams to consume on cluster of 100 nodes.  Building real time data processing pipe line using Storm, Kafka, Hbase.  Designed and developed highly scalable, faulttolerant and international ready web application framework that can handle over 7000qps at very low latency.  Hands on experience with solving performance, security, scalability and reliability problems for a highly trafficked web site (www.yahoo.com).  Experience in building scalable REST based web services using RestEasy.  Strong knowledge of OO concepts and developed applications on MVC framework.  Performed varied roles as Senior Engineer, Web Developer(UI), Sys Admin, Platform Engineer, Build & Release Engineer in my 8 years of IT experience and worked on a wide range of technologies  Java, PHP, Perl, ASP, C, Shell Scripting, Apache, MySQL, HTML, JS, CSS, RRD, IMAP, HTTP, LDAP, JSON, REST, GMAKE.  Ability to rapidly pick up new technologies, and apply new concepts and techniques to solve problems. Specialties:  Building large scale distributed systems using Hadoop, Map Reduce, Hbase, Hive, Oozie.  Real time data processing processing using Apache Storm, Kafka, Hbase.  Building, deploying and managing hadoop clusters which include capacity planning, performance tuning, resource monitoring etc.  Web crawling using Nutch, Content extraction from web pages using Apache Tika, semantic analysis of web pages.  Building scalable platforms/systems for web applications.  Java, PHP , Perl, C, Shell Scripting  Apache, MySQL,Tomcat, Nutch, BIRT,Apache Tika, Thrift, Protobuf, Memcache  HTML, REST, SOA, RRD, IMAP, LDAP, JSON, I18N

exp_summary1: Product catalog @WalmartLabs
exp_summary2: ALU acquired Kindsight Inc.
exp_summary3: Working on a url crawling platform that can crawl large number of URLs using Nutchbase.(Nutch+Hbase)  Working with data science team to build models for web page categorization using a custom taxonomy.  Content extraction from web pages using semantic analysis of web pages, Apache Tika and categorizing more than 5 million URLs per day on Hadoop using Mapreduce.  Working on a high performance low latency Java server based on MINA to serve out requests from Profiler and Ad serving components.  Upgrade existing cluster running Apache hadoop to Cloudera version of Hadoop without any data loss.
exp_summary4: # Responsible for building the module framework to allow easy development of modules that can be customized and used across multiple markets. # Performed benchmarking and profiling of the application to identify bottlenecks. # Optimized the frontpage server side duration to allow the site to scale better. # Design the plan for migrating yahoo homepage from one platform to another. # Responsible for CMS development efforts to allow editors to program content for FP. # Built apps/modules that run on the FP personal assist. # Migrate source code from cvs to svn. # Improved performance of existing build infrastructure by 5 times. # Wrote a custom build tool to package and build metro source code that serves 35+ intls. # Automated metro builds on Hudson. # Lead the dev effort for building FP on a new Web Service based architecture. # Currently working on cloud tech like hadoop, hive, hbase to generate analytic metrics for entire yahoo traffic.
exp_summary5: # Lead a team of 3 to design and implement an online site for conducting online examination for bank employees. # Created an automatic system to generate hall tickets for employees based on their home address and exam center address. # Developed shopping websites that handle ecommerce transactions. # Worked on building a web based email client using IMAP as backend. # Implemented address book for the company using LDAP. # Converted all C binaries used for authentication into PHP extensions for security and perf reasons. # Built a solution to track the network usage by different customers using RRD. # Designed and implemented a MySQL based site for celebrity chat. # Created an admin module for the chat application to ensure that profane messages are ignored.

exp_summary1: Perform Data Profiling , business rules for ETL operations of legacy & day-to-day data.  Perform business mapping specifications from legacy systems to SAS live system.  Provide significant rules and exit criteria conditions for GO-Live scenario.  Provide Functional & Technical Reconciliation between source and target system.  Resolve test cycle issues through HP ALM and fix key technical issues  Lead & Develop Insurance Objects in IBM Datastage.  Develop Data Analysis tool kit to automate data  Support reprocess of bad quality data
exp_summary2: Perform data analysis, extraction, cleansing, transformation, and create files for SAP migration. 	Prepare data mapping specifications from legacy systems to SAP system for conversion and interface FRICEW objects. 	Prepare functional specifications for conversion and interface FRICEW objects. 	Support for FUT/FAT, MOCK and pre GO-Live validations. 	Perform functional unit testing for all the conversion/Interface objects. 	Work with functional consultants closely to understand the gaps and form the mapping rules that meet the project standards 	Develop Insurance Objects in IBM Data Stage 	Perform Data Integrity check based on regional data ( UK & NORDIC ) 	Resolve critical technical issues and defects rose during the various migration cycles and provide necessary system analysis reports. 	Identification of data quality issues and reporting of these issues to the business 	Reconciliation of data and delivery of the relevant artefacts in a timely manner 	Understand and perform sanity check of the Insurance Systems ( Policy & Claim )
exp_summary3: Website Development using PHP, SQL
exp_summary4: Echomail - Mailing Services using Struts

exp_summary1: Kaar Technologies offers consultancy services to companies in the areas of ERP with a strong focus in SAP. Consulting apart, Kaar is involved in the development of SAP industry verticals for its partners in Europe, USA and for customers in India. With a strong focus on quality, consistent delivery and professional approach we deliver maximum value to our customers. The gamut of services offered by Kaar in the SAP arena is: - SAP Project Support Onsite / Offshore Model - SAP Application Management Services - SAP Development services for All-in-One Industry Verticals - SAP Implementation Services - SAP Upgrade Services - SAP Success Factors - C4C - SAP NetWeaver Services - SAP XI - SAP Enterprise Portal - SAP Module Implementation - SAP New Dimensional products - SAP BPC - SAP SSM - SAP SLcM - Interfaces with SAP - SAP MDM - SAP Business Intelligence (BI) - SAP EWM - SAP BPM Kaar serves its customers with a good mix of Content expertise, Process orientation, Customer friendly and User centric approach. With a motto of Exceeding the expectations of every customer everyday we bring maximum value to our customers by our dedication.

name: Selva Kumar
headline: Director at SysNet System and Solutions Pte Ltd
summary: With over 22+ years of managing large organizations with multiple levels of core information technologies .Have worked for Multinational Companies of high reputation with lot of overseas projects in countries like UAE ,China ,Malaysia , Thailand ,Ghana-Africa, Indonesia, Vietnam ,Philippine and India. I excel in the design and implementation phase of managing large scale networks and System related Projects that build on Microsoft & enterprise core technologies. I have been responsible for the design, configuration and administration of the highly available production environments, in which I oversee all of the network operations from the software development lifecycle to production. Driven by customer satisfaction, I work exceptionally well within the team to maintain maximum productivity and uptime. With over a decade of hands on experience in both network administration and system administration I can support both wide area networks (WAN) and local area networks (LAN). Windows 2012 Servers including FSMO, Active Directory, Group Policy, DNS, DHCP, LDAP, DFS, SCOM, SCCM, WSU, replication, NLB, clustering, Exchange 2010 Servers, SQL2012, Cisco Firewall and Routers, Major brand Switches and Firewalls, Symantec and Arcseve Backup software, Symantec Enterprise Antivirus solutions, Nortel, AVAYA phone systems, NAS Appliances ,Citrix Servers, SharePoint solutions, Blackberry Enterprise Servers, Hyper-V Servers and VMware related project Managenet Experience.

linkedin_projects: number_of_project_members:-0, project_title:-Active Directory 2003 To 2012 R2, Exchange 2003 To 2013 migration with Windows Server 2012 R2 Hyper-V Virtualization and Arcserve Backup r16.5, project_url:-http://www.iii.com.sg/, project_start_date:-2015-5, project_end_date:-2015-6, project_description:-Client: Indian International Insurance Pte Ltd 64 Cecil Street, #04-#05 IOB Building, Singapore 049711 http://www.iii.com.sg/  Designed and implemented Windows Server 2012 R2 Hyper-V Two Node Failover Cluster using IBM System X 3650 M5 Servers as Hyper-V Hosts and IBM Storwise V3700 Storage using Fiber Channel as Shared Storage.  Migrated Windows Server 2003 Active Directory to Windows Server 2012 R2 Active Directory.  Planned and migrated Microsoft Exchange 2003 to Exchange 2010 then to Exchange 2013. (Including 150+ Mailboxes)  Installed and configured WSUS and Print Services in Server 2012 R2 and used GPOs for deployments.  Migrated Server 2003 File Server to Server 2012 R2 File Server using DFS Replication and Microsoft Robocopy with existing NTFS File Permissions.  Installed and configured Arcserve Backup r16.5 as Tape Backup solution for the New Hyper-V virtualization infrastructure and as well as for Physical infrastructure.

exp_summary1: Project Manager 	Take care of Presales and Post sales team 	Responsible for SLA 	Ensure Service Delivery Operation 	Responsible for Post sales Job and Requirement and implementation 	Project Manager for IT implementation and Managed services Technical team leader Manage Subcontract project and documentation Project planning, analyze the customers requirement, and provide consultation and technical solutions for the new & on-going projects, Wintel /Citrix environment. Responsible for User Administration, Role Administration and Transportation of the Roles from Development system to Quality/Production System Implement and rollout global initiatives/projects based on the business requirement Maintaining User Administration for the Wintel / Citrix (Local & APAC Region) Monitoring the user access and solving their day-to-day problems Design lot of network infrastructure Which is including network Router , Firewall and VLAN and implementation lot of Windows Application servers with Web interface and publish the applications based on the projects requirement, Peform the necc profling and security settings accordance with banks policies, procedures and practices Managing mission critical applications Disaster Recovery Planning and Implement ting the servers for the DR switchover as per the banks standard procedure and policies Responsible for the Server High availability, performance and capacity management of the systems. name: Patric Samuel Paul
headline: Actively seeking opportunities in the Supply chain and Logistics field
summary: I have over 3 years experience in the Supply Chain and Logistics field across cross functional teams. Currently I work for a medical equipment manufacturer liaising with the Supply and Demand planners to fulfill the demands in the APAC/ANZ market . I gained experience in the following modules in SAP 	SAP ERP 	SAP SCM 	SAP BW HANA Previously I worked with an IT firm handling Enhancement and IT support for customers in the Logistics/Supply chain department across USA,UK,EUROPE and ASIA. Holding a Masters degree in Logistics and Supply Chain , I also worked with a mining company in Singapore handling supply chain projects as part of my curriculum for almost 9 months. Currently seeking full time opportunities in the Supply chain and Logistics field. Technical expertise : *MS VISIO, MS Excel,ERP systems *SQL,C,C++ & Mainframe technology Managerial skills: Business Analytics,Corporate Presentations,Desk research and Respondent validation,People management,Team building and Data interpreting. Research activity: Optimized Distribution model using Six Sigma ,Renewable energy resource utilization for building Solar and Wind Hybrid energy system.

Being free from existing allegiances and perceptions, they are ideally placed to make difficult decisions objectively. An EBI interim executive gives your organization quick, flexible access to a highly experienced professional who can simultaneously take on project management, advisory and leadership roles at senior management and C level. They can act as a mentor for your management team, and give you practical support to find effective solutions. Your EBI interim practitioner is used to taking responsibility and achieving exceptional results quickly. They will bring a fresh sense of perspective and motivation, and the cost of hiring them will be far outweighed by the benefits they will provide. Our approach is consultative, knowledgeable and collaborative, which we achieve through understanding our clients and their businesses. Our goal is to match the best, most experienced interim managers from our Global Practitioner Database with our clients' immediate needs quickly and effectively. To ensure customers get the best person for the job, EBI has developed an extensive up-to-date Global Practitioner Database of 1,000+ managers from within the industry, who are available as interim project managers as and when required. These practitioners all are experienced professionals with over 10 years practical experience in their respective area of expertise and as such are able to hit the ground running. The group is open to professional across all sectors. We hold an annual conference for the industry and more information can be found on our website. <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=2290305&goback=, group_name:-Supply Chain Young Professionals, no_of_members:-8008, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/p/3/005/019/3ab/24b0790.png, group_id:-2290305, group_description:-We are an organization founded and managed by young professionals for young professionals. Providing members with an opportunity to develop relationships with an international community of peers and mentors, expand their knowledge of the supply chain industry, and apply their knowledge and skills in real world situations. We have partnered with the ISCEA (International Supply Chain Education Alliance..www.iscea.org) to create more value for our members by accessing their resources- mentors, companies, passes to SCM conferences, workshops and a lot more. Unlike other groups, we do not want to push "chapters" when a functioning organization exists. We encourage current supply chain oriented chapters/organizations to join the SCNext to share with each other best practices, experiences, events and resources. If you are a member of the CSCMP, APICS, ISCEA, ISM, or any University organization around the world join the SCNext and represent your group. honor_summary2: URL: http://innovationjockeys.net/past_season/say-goodbye-to-your-summer-power-woes/ The hybrid home power system uses a solar panel fixed to the center of the windmill pole. Special reflective mirrors improve the efficiency of the solar power while the windmill has specially designed fiber blades which rotate even at low wind speed.The system generates about 550-600W and can be installed at any place at a reasonable cost.The cost of installation here is cheaper when compared to other resources. While hydel energy is also a renewable source of energy, creating hydro-electric plants degrades the environment. The hybrid system provides clean energy at no cost to the environment whatsoever.
honor_title2: Domestic Solar and Wind hybrid energy system

name: Vipul Vyas
headline: Director Operations at HCL Technologies
summary: Accomplished, dynamic, versatile, hands-on Program Manager with 18+ years of professional experience in leading teams to design, implement and deliver IT projects and services that align business and IT objectives and deliver rapid results. Energetic, trusted, and detail-oriented strategic solutions provider with outstanding program management skills. Hand-picked by executive team to turn around underperforming programs; accomplished leader known and respected for leading successful change in projects and building credibility with executive teams and staff. Solutions driver who bridges the gap between business and technology with expertise in managing complex programs and multiple concurrent projects. Runs IT operations and delivers high visibility programs that solve business problems and provide tangible results for enterprise in Education, Media and Entertainment domain. Vipul brings with him experience in working with various scales of client engagement that includes developing IT solution portfolios across multiple technologies and industry verticals, delivery organization design and delivery, service strategy design and delivery, large engagement transitions, IT strategy, pre-sales, direct sales support, performance management, large scale transformation programs to list key few. Specialties: Media and Entertainment, Publishing, Music and Education industry domain
